Sentencas: A new approach for lower operating temperature solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) interconnections (IC) consisting of a bi-layer structure is proposed and analyzed.
Titulo: Bi-layer structures as solid oxide fuel cell interconnections

Sentencas: The bi-layer structure consists of a p-type layer exposed to cathodic gas (air/oxygen) and an n-type layer exposed to anodic gas (fuel).
Titulo: Bi-layer structures as solid oxide fuel cell interconnections

Sentencas: It is theoretically shown that the interfacial oxygen partial pressure which is an important designing variable, is dependent primarily on the oxygen partial pressure gradient across the IC, the low level oxygen conductivities of the two layers and is largely independent of their electronic conductivities and the total current density through the IC material.
Titulo: Bi-layer structures as solid oxide fuel cell interconnections

Sentencas: By careful design of the composition and thicknesses of the two layers, one can, in principle, obtain an IC with a low cell-to-cell resistance.
Titulo: Bi-layer structures as solid oxide fuel cell interconnections
Bi-layer structures as solid oxide fuel cell interconnections
